data.text:
In this article, we have given details about who is Amanda Peet married to, check this to know about her husband, who is a screenwriter, and find out how many kids Amanda Peet has with him.

Amanda Peet

Amanda Peet was born on January 11, 1972, in New York City, U.S. Amanda Peet is an American actress known for her roles in both television and film. She started with minor parts on TV before making her film debut in 1995's Animal Room. Peet gained wider recognition for her role as Jill St.

Claire in The Whole Nine Yards (2000) and has appeared in various movies such as Saving Silverman, High Crimes, Changing Lanes, Igby Goes Down, Something's Gotta Give, Identity, Melinda and Melinda, A Lot Like Love, Syriana, The X-Files: I Want to Believe, 2012, Gulliver's Travels, Identity Thief, and The Way, Way Back.

Apart from her film work, Amanda Peet has also appeared on various television shows. She played Jacqueline Barrett on The WB's Jack & Jill (1999â2001), Jordan McDeere on NBC's short-lived Aaron Sorkin series Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip (2006-2007), Tina Morris on HBO's Togetherness (2015â2016), Jules on IFC's Brockmire (2016â2020), and Betty Broderick on the second season of Bravo's Dirty John (2020).

In addition, she played Beth Gallagher in the Paramount+ adaptation of Fatal Attraction (2023). In 2021, Peet wrote and co-executive produced The Chair for Netflix. She is married to American screenwriter David Benioff and they have three children together.

Who is Amanda Peet Married to?

Amanda Peet is married to American screenwriter and producer David Benioff. The couple met when they were both attending college at the same university. They got married in September 2006 and have three children together. Benioff co-created the hit HBO series "Game of Thrones" and has also worked on other popular TV shows and films.

While the couple is notoriously private about their personal life 1, they have been seen attending events together over the years and Peet has spoken warmly about her husband in interviews. Peet and Benioff got married in September 2006 and have three children together.

Despite being a prolific writer and producer, Benioff has managed to maintain a relatively low profile in Hollywood, preferring to stay out of the public eye as much as possible. He has spoken warmly about his wife in interviews, saying that they make a good team and that he admires her talent and work ethic.

While Peet and Benioff are generally private about their personal life, they have been seen attending events together over the years. Peet has also praised her husband's talent and success in interviews, saying that she is proud of him and grateful for his support as she pursues her own career. The couple seems to have a strong and supportive partnership that has endured for over a decade.

Amanda Peet Husband

Amanda Peet, a budding actor at the time, and David Benioff, who was just starting his career as a screenwriter, met in 2002. They fell in love, got engaged, and tied the knot in September 2006. Over the past two decades, the couple has become one of Hollywood's most successful pairs, raising three children together - Frances Pen, Molly June, and Henry Peet. David Benioff is a respected screenwriter and producer in Hollywood, best known for co-creating the acclaimed HBO series "Game of Thrones".

David was born on September 25, 1970, in New York City and studied at Dartmouth College before attending Trinity College in Dublin and the University of California, Irvine, where he earned an MFA in creative writing. Benioff began his career writing novels and short stories before transitioning to screenwriting in the late 1990s.

In addition to "Game of Thrones", which ran from 2011 to 2019 and won numerous awards, Benioff has also worked on other successful TV shows, including "The 25th Hour", "Troy", and "X-Men Origins: Wolverine". He has also written several films, including "The Kite Runner" and "Stay". Benioff and Peet first met while both attending Tufts University in Massachusetts. They got married in 2006 and have three children together.

The couple is notoriously private about their personal life and rarely appears in public together. However, Peet has spoken warmly about her husband's talent and work ethic, calling him a "genius" in interviews. In recent years, Benioff has focused on producing rather than writing. He has produced films such as "City of Thieves" and "25th Hour" and served as an executive producer on the films "The Reader" and "Red Tails". He is also an executive producer on the upcoming Apple TV+ series "Invasion".

Is Amanda Peet Jewish?

Amanda Peet's mother is Jewish, and although she was raised in a Quaker household, she has been open about her Jewish identity and cultural heritage. In interviews, Peet has discussed her experiences growing up with a mixed religious background and the challenges of navigating her identity in Hollywood. She has also highlighted the importance of representation and diversity in the entertainment industry, speaking out about issues such as sexism, ageism, and racism.

Peet has been involved in several Jewish-themed projects throughout her career. In 2015, she co-wrote a children's book called "Dear Santa, Love Rachel Rosenstein" which tells the story of a young Jewish girl who wishes she could celebrate Christmas like her friends but eventually learns to appreciate her own traditions.

Peet has also appeared in a number of films and TV shows with Jewish themes, including "High Crimes", "The Whole Nine Yards", and "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip". Beyond her work in Hollywood, Peet has been an advocate for a variety of social and political causes. She has been active in organizations such as Planned Parenthood, the Human Rights Campaign, and the Natural Resources Defense Council, and has spoken out on issues such as climate change, gun violence prevention, and women's healthcare.

Amanda Peet Children

Amanda Peet, an accomplished actress, has starred in numerous films and television shows, including "Jack & Jill," "The Whole Nine Yards," and "The Chair." She is also a mother to three children with her husband, David Benioff, who is known for being the showrunner of "Game of Thrones." Despite keeping her children out of the spotlight, Peet has discussed her experience with motherhood and believes that pursuing her passions sets a good example for her children.

Frances Pen Friedman

Peet's first child, Frances Pen Friedman, was born on Feb. 20, 2007. Although Peet has not shared many details about Frances, she did discuss the challenges of being a new mother with People in April of that year. Peet recently mentioned during an interview on "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" in April 2023 that Frances is now a teenager and made a joke about Peet's and Benioff's looks.

Molly June Friedman

Amanda Peet's second child, Molly June Friedman, was born on April 19, 2010. In an interview with Us Weekly, Peet revealed that she and her husband had a tough time deciding on the name for their newborn, and they ultimately chose the name Molly June through a cutthroat process. Similar to Peet's eldest child, Molly has been kept away from the public eye.

Henry Peet Friedman

Amanda Peet and David Benioff's third child, Henry Peet Friedman, was born on December 7, 2014. The couple kept the pregnancy private and did not disclose the gender of their baby until October of that year. In an interview with People after Henry's birth, Peet revealed that she was tired but excited about the new addition to their family. Like their other children, Henry is kept out of the public eye.

Amanda Peet is married to David Benioff, who is a screenwriter and producer.

5. What is Amanda Peet's husband best known for?
